At that time, the heavenly king Musulunda, together with the heavenly multitudes, in the garden groves and wonderful lotus ponds, with immeasurable various desires, gradually ascended to the peak of the All-Observing Mountain and the other places.
Having arrived there, by the power of good karma, they immediately see the gates of the evil paths open, and see celestial maidens who are about to fall due to the exhaustion of their karmic rewards.
Because they are about to fall, nine signs appear first, namely:
First, the skin becomes loose and too soft, because it is wrinkled.
Second, the body moves.
Because the body moves, the flowers on the head scatter and fall off.
There is a third sign of decline that has already appeared, namely:
The red flowers on the head turn yellow.
There is a fourth sign of decline that has already appeared, namely:
A wind comes and blows on their clothes, and the threadless clothes become like human clothes with threads.
There is a fifth sign of decline that has already appeared, namely:
When flying in the air, they become tired, and the same is true when walking on the ground.
There is a sixth sign of decline that has already appeared, namely:
The sweat on the body, which was originally clear, now becomes turbid.
There is a seventh sign of decline that has already appeared, namely:
When they go under the trees to pick flowers and fruits, the tree branches rise high and cannot be reached, so they cannot pick them.
There is also an eighth sign of impending fall, namely:
When the heavenly beings come to have sex together, they see the heavenly maidens as ugly and unappealing.
There is also a ninth sign of impending fall, namely:
There is a wind that comes and scatters their hair, making it unpliant and rough to the touch.
When these signs of impending fall appear, the heavenly beings will not fall for several tens of days, which is equivalent to two thousand years in the human realm.
There are also two kinds of signs of impending fall for the heavenly maidens. When they appear, it is time for them to fall.
They are as follows:
First, their desire increases and they cannot stay still for a moment.
Second,
when they are on the ground, the ground is not soft and pliable. When they step down, their feet sink in and do not rebound when they lift their feet.
They cannot stay alone and call out to other heavenly maidens, saying:
'I am feeling faint, come stay with me here.'
' The celestial maiden who is about to fall will also have other signs of decline manifest, namely:
Her lips move restlessly, without any reason for speech, moving and not stopping.
The celestial maiden who is about to fall will also have other signs of decline manifest, namely:
She forgets all the singing and dancing she used to do.
When she was first born, she could sing and dance without being taught by anyone else, and she knew everything naturally due to her good karma;
But when she is about to fall, because her good karma is exhausted, she forgets everything.
The celestial maiden who is about to fall will also have other signs of decline manifest, namely:
If she goes near a lotus pond or flowing river, she will see in the water the place where she will be reborn, seeing the form of her body in the realm where she is about to be born.
The celestial maiden who is about to fall will also have other signs of decline manifest, namely:
The ornaments on their bodies, whether necklaces or bracelets, all become heavy.
There are also other signs of the celestial maidens' decline that manifest, namely:
Wherever they sit, their seats all change.
If they sit on gold, lapis lazuli, or indranÄ«la, all those jewels turn into wood.
There are also other signs of the celestial maidens' decline that manifest, namely:
What they originally saw as earth, they now see as different.
There are also other signs of the celestial maidens' decline that manifest, namely:
Sweat breaks out all over their bodies.
There are also other signs of decline that manifest in the human realm, namely:
The eyes see the celestial beings all spinning, like seeing a spinning wheel, and do not see the celestial bodies.
All the faculties take no pleasure in objects, and the mind thinks:
'I have no savior now.
' Because their lives are about to end, they see the place of rebirth as if seeing with their own eyes.
As explained before, when those celestial maidens' lives end and they are about to fall, in their last thought, their lives end and they give rise to an intermediate existence.

Driven by desire for women, these celestial beings are bound here,

Desire is the greatest bondage, able to bind this world;

Observing the immeasurable variety of ways, they are certain to fall. Again, they observe the five sense pleasures of other gods and experience various pleasures, not fearing falling, like animals. They think:

Seeing various objects, their minds were firmly attached, pulled by the bonds of craving accumulated since beginningless time towards that river, the sounds of various pleasures binding their minds, they played and enjoyed themselves together.

On both banks of the river are many joyful gods. They sing and dance together, their minds filled with supreme joy. They enjoy various pleasures on the riverbanks, with the sounds of the five types of music equally delightful. They experience boundless pleasures of the five senses.

Because of the good karma of the birds, they mutually experience supreme joy and, for the benefit of the gods, speak these verses:

Because of delusion, they do not realize this and continue in such heedless conduct.
The lives and pleasures of all beings do not linger.
The foolish are unaware, like the born-blind on the path.
It is better to be blind without eyes than to be foolishly attached to desires,
Following desires for pleasure, heading towards hell.
Not because of blindness is there hell, but because of not knowing the Dharma.
Therefore, it is better to be self-blinded than to be controlled by desires.
Desires do not benefit, always deceiving and confusing the foolish,
Because of the delusion of one's own mind, one does not renounce desires.
If one engages in desires, there is no wisdom or knowledge,
Not counting the suffering born of desires, one always delights in desires.
Seeing desires as enemies like friends, like the bread-fruit,

Just as the waters of all rivers flow without returning,

The bird thus stayed in the tree and spoke this verse according to the truth of its karma.
At that time, the gods, whose minds were cultivated by good karma, heard the verse and became extremely disgusted. They thought like this:
'Now I have heard the Dharma from an animal like this. Therefore, I know that my indulgent conduct will definitely lead me into evil paths.'

All beings are subject to old age and death,
you have no mind, intention, thought, or consideration.
As long as the body is not destroyed, as long as there is purity in the world,

' In this way, the gods mutually follow the Dharma in their minds, speaking such verses and contemplating the Dharma in this way.

Before long, their faculties become weak and powerless, and they no longer contemplate. Seeing countless delightful and enjoyable objects of the five desires, following their mental inclinations, they go to other gods in order to experience pleasure.

In this way, the gods are confused by objects. The causes of the five objects always increase heavenly desires. They experience heavenly bliss in that place, enjoying the bliss that accords with the most delightful objects of the five desires.

If they fall from the heavens or are reborn among humans, they will have the utmost happiness and no afflictions, the highest wealth and joy, and will be born into the most distinguished family, respected and revered by all, without fear or illness, and have the highest intelligence. That blessed deva is born in such a place of merit due to the power of immeasurable good karma.
At that time, the deva who is born in that place is born in the mountains, in a mountain called Gana.

In this way, the mind is concentrated, and before long, one becomes attached to the pleasures of the five desires of the realm.

In the gardens, forests, and lotus ponds, in extremely delightful places, the five desires and five kinds of music are all complete. Surrounded by countless celestial maidens, there are countless kinds, countless distinctions, and countless thoughts.
In the mountains and forests, as previously described, due to the good karma of the celestial sons, they experience various kinds of pleasures of the five desires in this way.
Having experienced such pleasures of desire, by the power of good karma, they see five kinds of rare and unusual forms in the mountains.
What are the five?
Namely:
Where were they born and came to be born here? They see where they came from;
By what karmic causes and conditions did they come to be born here? They see those karmic causes and conditions;
When will they fall? They see the time of their fall;
Having seen their fall, where will they be born?
Seeing the place of birth, having been born there, one experiences suffering and happiness.
Seeing that suffering and happiness, one sees the same in the affairs of others.
The heavenly beings also see different times, either a hundred eons or a billion eons of their own affairs, and know like this:
'I have been born in this heaven before. Although I know the number of births, I do not know the number of eons.
Why is this?
Because of having little wisdom, one is unable to contemplate the power of that mountain.
It is because of the power of good karma that one sees like this.'

However, after the heavenly beings have seen countless rare things, they fear the faults of birth and death, and become disgusted with good karma, let alone non-meritorious karma, which they also become disgusted with, and also leave mixed karma.
Because they all have the fault of suffering, and because mixed karma has many faults.
Having seen this, having seen the rare things in the mountain, they fear and become disgusted with the place of birth and death that has faults.
At all times, various kinds of misfortune increase. Seeing the rope and beam, the mind becomes detached from other pleasures and is not happy.
What is called pleasure:
The touch, taste, color, and smell of desire in the heavens.
Thus, seeing touch, taste, color, and smell is like seeing poisonous food, and it is not considered pleasure.
Having seen such immeasurable kinds of heavenly pleasures, one detests them and is not happy.
Having become detached from desire in this way, one speaks to other gods, causing them to do beneficial and happy things.
Those gods thus practice well with body, speech, and mind, and perform good deeds.

The Dharma teacher, if able to speak the true Dharma for others, for those sentient beings who are heedless, fully possesses the Buddha's words and speaks the Dharma for them, fearing heedless conduct.
Heedless sentient beings enter immeasurable evil realms of objects, for those sentient beings he speaks of five kinds of fears, namely the five:
The fear of birth, the fear of old age, the fear of sickness, the fear of death, the fear of one's own karma, and so forth.
These sentient beings, due to such karmic actions, obtain delightful objects and are afraid of separation.

If one can show these fears to others, not for the sake of material gain, not with a deceitful mind, and not out of the desire for offerings, then one can correctly expound the Buddha's teachings for others.
There are also those who expound the Buddha's teachings to others in a mixed way:
As they have heard, with corresponding parables.
Fearing their own meager learning and little reading of the Buddha's words, they push the time to the future, using different parables.
Having heard from others, they speak from their own thoughts, their minds greedy for many mixed words, pushing the time to the future, speaking the Dharma in this way.
Such causes and conditions create the fear of birth and death.
They see various karmic actions in the mountains.
Among all these dharmas, there are superior ones, namely:
